what: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: PremPredict package helps generate sensible predictions individual games entire season Premier League. can find automatically-updated Premier League predictor (uses codebase) landing page repo.

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: use simplified version David Firth’s approach data Open Football repo GitHub predict outcome season’s Premier League. predictions based team’s strength, given performance recent times. define recent? order duck question, choose number different time periods. Please note 0.0% 100.0% outcomes results necessarily signify certainty specific assessment, : model typically used 1,000 simulations; pertinently model (like models) imperfect (, think, better model )

title: A dataset containing the results of the Premier League from previous seasons. — previous_seasons
A dataset containing the results of the Premier League from previous seasons. — previous_seasons
text: data frame many rows (one game recent history involves two current Premier League teams) 10 variables: number_match character index game question number_match_integer integer version number_match matchday date game occurred homeTeam shortName team played home match awayTeam shortName team played away match FTHG goals scored team played home match FTAG goals scored team played away match FTR result match, factor "" (away win), "D" (draw) "H" (home win) played logical indicating game played yet year_end calendar year season ended
